content: ok im 16 and turning 17 in a couple of day. I dont have a GED or HSD and I was wondering if I can sill see a recruiter and send me to an Army Prep School since i dont fully have the education requirements. P.S__all help and information is appreciated

title: Education problems

content: For now...forget the military, go back to school, get your diploma. Decide which hranch of the military you like, talk to a recruiter for that branch. I doubt the military allows anyone to enlist who does not have a high school diploma! Good luck! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

title: Education problems

content: As far as the Army, the answer is no - you must have a GED or diploma before you are eligible to serve. That's just the fact. Go Google "GED prep test." There are lots and lots of free sites to help you prepare for it. Then go to any local community college and take the GED test and pass it (was about 2 hours when I took it). Then you're golden! My best wishes to you! Oh, and if you're seriously considering serving, get some free websites up for the ASVAB pre-test. They will help you immensely, as the ASVAB score will dictate what you can "do" (MOS) in the military, which branch(es) you can serve in, and etc. The higher the score, the more options; the more options, the better for you. Again, my best wishes! It's not that there is no God or that He isn't listening. You're probably just asking the wrong questions.

title: Education problems

content: Joining the service provides an opportunity to serve your nation. That isn't accomplished by hoping for the best or by good luck. Basic educational skills are not only necessary for the Army, but also for you to become successful and responsible in life. Pay your dues now. Make every effort to improve yourself first. Consider the Army when you're more prepared. Good luck.
